Quotes: Those who write clearly have readers, those who write obscurely have commentators.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: After all manner of professors have done their best for us, the place we are to get knowledge is in books. The true university of these days is a collection of books.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: He that composes himself is wiser than he that composes a book.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: You cannot open a book without learning something.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: I would rather discover one scientific fact than become King of Persia.
Author: Democritus

Quotes: There is no friend as loyal as a book.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: A man's got to take a lot of punishment to write a really funny book.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: There are events which are so great that if a writer has participated in them his obligation is to write truly rather than assume the presumption of altering them with invention.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: If a writer knows enough about what he is writing about, he may omit things that he knows. The dignity of movement of an iceberg is due to only one ninth of it being above water.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Read not to contradict and confute, nor to believe and take for granted... but to weigh and consider.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: The aphorism in which I am the first master among Germans, are the forms of "eternity";my ambition is to say in ten sentences what everyone else says in a book - what everyone else does not say in a book.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: I don't know who said that novelists read the novels of others only to figure out how they are written. I believe it's true. We aren't satisfied with the secrets exposed on the surface of the page: we turn the book around to find the seams.
Author: Gabriel Jose Garcia Marquez

Quotes: Practically everybody in New York has half a mind to write a book, and does.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: I hate books;they only teach us to talk about things we know nothing about.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: If a man writes a book, let him set down only what he knows. I have guesses enough of my own.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: If I don't write to empty my mind, I go mad.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: I don't give a damn for a man that can only spell a word one way.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Ideally a book would have no order to it, and the reader would have to discover his own.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: All the ills of mankind, all the tragic misfortunes that fill the history books, all the political blunders, all the failures of the great leaders have arisen merely from a lack of skill at dancing.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: The good ended happily, and the bad unhappily. That is what fiction means.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Publishers see free downloads as threatening the sales of the book.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: I have my favorite cat, who is my paperweight, on my desk while I am writing.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: I cannot live without books.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
Author: Victor Hugo
